author: m.kalinin
content: The goal of this method is to give CL and infrastructure maintainers an ability to ping EL leading up to the Merge to be sure that EL is responding and properly configured, i.e. ready for the Merge. There is no necessity in calling it post Merge, and even pre Merge it isn't a requirement and rather a nice to have thing

author: tersec
content: At least so far, in terms of trust model, I've viewed the EL and CL as fundamentally being part of the same unit of trusted-or-not-trusted, and such attacks as being (to borrow Raymond Chen's phrasing, discussing when, e.g., people point out that privileged users can do privileged-user-things on Windows, and that's not a vuln or exploit) "on the other side of the airlock". This 1:1 EL:CL match that's being encouraged would support this -- people aren't really supposed to be using pairing with random ELs with their CLs anyway, no?

author: m.kalinin
content: This ping functionality isn't aiming to address issues related to trust between EL and CL. It helps to be sure that your own EL is ready for the merge, especially, this may be helpful for owners of multiple nodes. And yes, CL and EL are two parts of the same node actually, and the assumption is that they both trust each other. Ofc, some times it makes sense to double check that the counter party isn't failing when it is possible

author: djrtwo
content: yeah-- ping is purely to saniy check the setup prior to the merge when an operator might be uncertain about this new/novel configuration

author: g11tech
content: you can easily testout devnet 4 with lodestar's simple script: https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/tree/master/kiln/devnets , all you need it 1. git, 2. docker, 3. ubuntu linux (could be work on other linux enviornments too), and just run the command : `./setup.sh --dataDir devnet4-data --elClient nethermind --devnetVars ./devnet4.vars --dockerWithSudo  --withTerminal "gnome-terminal --disable-factory --"` it will auto download the config, compatible docker images, and pop them out in separate terminals

author: g11tech
content: hi <@!425572898787426305> , <@!758579010027782144> and I were trying to interop lodestar <>nethermind with the new `engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1` api, and we got few doubts:

author: g11tech
content: From my understanding of specs, this api returns to CL what has been "configured" on EL, not the actual terminal PoW data

author: g11tech
content: because if it returns actual PoW data, we/CL might have issues(or do additional work) in matching

author: g11tech
content: for e.g. if only TTD is set, the actual terminal block could be different depending on the fork difference between CL and EL (and EL is syncing)

author: g11tech
content: or CL doesn't yet has terminal blockhash (ZERO hash) but EL does and gives back

author: g11tech
content: so just to reiterate the doubt: EL should only return what has been "configured" because that is static and 100% match able with ease.

author: g11tech
content: i.e. even if EL has terminal block details, it should just return the set TTD, zero block hash in terminal block, and 0 in the block number (for e.g. in the case where only TTD is configured at both EL and CL)
